To fix the save game issue:

1) Open Finder, go to the Applications folder, right click on "GTA Vice City" and select "Show Package Contents".

2) Inside the package, navigate to Contents and then Resources.

3) Open user.reg and userdef.reg with your favorite editor.  Replace all occurrences of "Tigran" with the username you use to log in to OS X.  (Open terminal and type whoami if you're unsure.)

Note: The %USERNAME% environment variable will not work, you must use your username.  I'm assuming this has something to do with Wineskin changing the username from "Wineskin" to your actual username after launch, but I'm not 100% sure.

4) Save both files and start GTA.  You should now be able to save games.  If you already have a save game that you want to add, make a folder called "GTA Vice City User Files" within your local "Documents" folder and copy the GTAVCsf1.b to the folder you just created.

For those that want windowed mode, you'll need to edit two files.

1) /Applications/GTA Vice City.app/Contents/Info.plist

Change: novdx24sleep0

To: Current Resolutionx24sleep0

2) /Applications/GTA Vice City.app/Contents/Resources/user.reg

Change: "Decorated"="N"

To: "Decorated"="Y"

To revert back to full screen, just reverse the steps.

For those of you not sure what to do with the 3 files you get, go download a program like "UnRarX" or "The Unarchiver" and use one of those to open the first file.  Keep all 3 files together in their own folder (place all in one folder) and the program will do the rest for you.

Here's a mod on how fix the save game issues posted by knif (I just added a step making the replacement of the occurence "Tigran" easier)


1) Open Finder, go to the Applications folder, right click on "GTA Vice City" and select "Show Package Contents".

2) Inside the package, navigate to Contents and then Resources.

3) Open user.reg and userdef.reg with your favorite editor (i.e. Text Edit). Replace all occurrences of "Tigran" (See step 4) with the username you use to log in to OS X. (Open terminal and type whoami if you're unsure.) 

4) Using apple F (command F) on your keyboard will open a search tool to simplify the replacement.  

Note: The %USERNAME% environment variable will not work, you must use your username. I'm assuming this has something to do with Wineskin changing the username from "Wineskin" to your actual username after launch, but I'm not 100% sure.

4) Save both files and start GTA. You should now be able to save games. If you already have a save game that you want to add, make a folder called "GTA Vice City User Files" within your local "Documents" folder and copy the GTAVCsf1.b to the folder you just created.
